topic.title: Discuss (U2): Rock Cycle Interactive
topic.text:
This chapter focuses on geologic time, and the rock cycle check out this fun  "Rock Cycle Interactive" exercise for collecting rocks. 

After you have finished the exercise in collecting rocks:

  • Describe your childhood interactions with rocks.
    • Were you one of those kids who came home with rocks in your pockets? Did you have a rock collection? Did you have a favorite type of rock or mineral? Or did you interact with rocks in other ways (e.g. climbing, skipping them across the water, etc.)?
  • Now, think about your immediate environment or some place that you recently visited.
    • Identify the area you are thinking about
    • Identify what types of rocks (sedimentary, igneous, metamorphic) you have encountered there.
    • Describe at least one specific rock you encountered using terms like those found on the  "Types of Rocks" screen of the exercise (e.g. crystals, fossils, gas bubbles, glassy surface, ribbonlike layers, and/or containing sand or pebbles).
    • If you don't have a particular rock in mind, go for a walk and find one, to use in responding to this part of the discussion.

Initial posts are due on Wednesday by 11:59pm, in which you use full sentences and proper grammar.

Respond to at least two other students' posts (at a minimum), which are due on Sunday by 11:59pm.

  • Be sure to respond to other students' posts with a substantive comment using full sentences and proper grammar.
